positive.review: Very calming. I'd say it's good for more than studying. I personally use this to help me get chores done, read in my down time, as well as studying. It keeps you on track, very pleasing on the eyes, there's even some options that let you pick what clothing or accessories she wears, the animal on her desk as well as what types of fish you want. The music is great, you can add or take away what you want and the options are pretty catchy. (THE LOFI IS AWESOME) Anyways definitely recommend! Especially to the cozy gamer types

Chill ... is the word that describes it perfectly.
Does what it suppose to do in well designed pixel graphics settings thats pleasant to look at and has great music library. 
Some of the competition are a bit too much interactive. They can become a distraction instead of helping in concentrating. Which could be a good or bad thing depending on what you want. 
But if you want simple yet pleasant productivity utility that helps you concentrate and chill, you really can't go wrong with this. And if you want more interaction you can always switch between them to get utilize the best of both.
Love the letter system, it makes the community feel so warm.
Very nice app, helping with focus. I like the collections in game (pets, accessories, rooms). I wish there was possibility to adjust sound for timer alarm. It is very loud when my PC volume is up.
good game that help with managing task while also reminding you when to take breaks

Love ChillPulse, I was having so much trouble concentrating on my studies and this has really helped! I've been able to focus better and I even smashed out an entire 1500 word thesis in one day. 

I would love if there was more character customisation at the base level so that you can choose hair & skin colour, etc. Also, it would be good to be able to choose what genre of lo-fi you want to listen to instead of having to skip through the song list. Can't wait to see more scenes! :)
Great for people with ADHD that need to focus on homework.
AmazingÔºÅ

Leaving a bad review just because Chill Pulse is simpler than Spirit City: Lofi Sessions makes no sense to me. I'll always pick Chill Pulse; it's supposed to help you focus, not bombard you with stuff just to scratch the brain itch. 
I recently bought it and honestly it's been a huge help. I can focus better on my studies and it really calms down the ADHD monkey brain. The songs are great, some help me stay in the zone, others are perfect for breaks because they're a bit more catchy. You can also turn them off and leave just nature sounds in the background, which is really nice. I've also been making progress on my book since I started using it and that is truly shocking for me. It actually helps me form a routine and stay consistent and somehow it tricks my brain into this because I see it like a game that I like to play, so it's like a quest. I love the cozy graphics, the interface which is very easy to use and the Pomodoro timer with the alarm is super helpful, together with the calendar and to-do list. Oh and the letters! Sometimes I send one and the replies make me giggle, it's such a cute touch!
Thank you for creating this. ‚ô•

PROS
beautiful stylized graphic, better than the 3d stuff imo. simple and does not have an overwhelming amount of animation or *pings*. super calming to use and really does help with focusing. 

CONS
- I wish there was an option to turn off the +experience fire icon that shows up when you go into focus mode. i've gotten used to it now, but at the beginning I couldn't help looking at it, instead of working... 

- if you want to turn off certain songs/tracks, you have to click them one by one. it'll be cool if there was a select all option or a drag and select option.

- you can only decorate your character's clothes, accessories and change the pets. however you can't really add anything to the room itself, or the desk the character is working on, or change the overall appearance of the character.

BLUF: Cozy background and ambiance. Not a game. Great Lofi tunes, Pomodoro timer for ADHD focus. Fun little games to add to the atmosphere.

I use this as a DM while prepping for my D&D games. Helps me not lose track of time while doing research, diving deep into lore and world building. To-Do List and sticky notes are handy. Music selection is fabulous. Customizing my character and her surroundings is a great bonus and minor distraction break that's fun. Pets just sit on your desk and look cute. But the fish!!

Nice app to gamify your studies or routine. I liked the collections in game (pets, accessories, rooms). User Interface is easy to work with, but for me it's only 4/5. My problem was sound for timer -- too loud and disruptive. And I would love to see in game stats for all my playtime like the number of finished tasks, all focus hours and so on. Your Planner let you see only day by day stats.
It gets repetitive but I got my money's worth. I enjoyed the different atmospheres and customization options!

I've been using this game as background noise to studying, and it fills the role well! I like the pomodoro timer, and that I can customize the time. I was surprised that there are little story bits via the ingame phone "chats", and they are so sweet!

Dear membership,  due to reached about 50 hours of game play,  I would like to advise,  if maybe possible to close whole achievements at about 70+ hours,  or make some additionals!? ü§î
With love to read,  any , even critical responds 
The game is Beatiful,  and original itself,  but the time is long enough ü§î

Very calming. I'd say it's good for more than studying. I personally use this to help me get chores done, read in my down time, as well as studying. It keeps you on track, very pleasing on the eyes, there's even some options that let you pick what clothing or accessories she wears, the animal on her desk as well as what types of fish you want. The music is great, you can add or take away what you want and the options are pretty catchy. (THE LOFI IS AWESOME) Anyways definitely recommend! Especially to the cozy gamer types

Chill ... is the word that describes it perfectly.
Does what it suppose to do in well designed pixel graphics settings thats pleasant to look at and has great music library. 
Some of the competition are a bit too much interactive. They can become a distraction instead of helping in concentrating. Which could be a good or bad thing depending on what you want. 
But if you want simple yet pleasant productivity utility that helps you concentrate and chill, you really can't go wrong with this. And if you want more interaction you can always switch between them to get utilize the best of both.
Love the letter system, it makes the community feel so warm.
Very nice app, helping with focus. I like the collections in game (pets, accessories, rooms). I wish there was possibility to adjust sound for timer alarm. It is very loud when my PC volume is up.
Love this Game. It's not really a game though is more like a fun productive tool but I love it non the less. Really cute and cozy.
I like the feature of anonymous letters. Everyone's responses are very warm-hearted. But recently, there have been some maliciously abusive replies, which is very upsetting.
Nice graphics and music, and the timers do their job. Aesthetic and a nice study buddy.
Great for studying and chilling while working. 100% recommend.
A great game for helping with learning which makes me relax during that time.

A neat little pomodoro tool with gamification tools. I love the mechanic of mixing up drinks to get bonuses during your pomodoro. The huge drawback of the game as it is right now: Your character's clothing and accessories can be customized but other than that, no customization. If you're coming from Spirit City you'll probably be disappointed in that. Basically if you are not a slim brunette with light skin then your Chill Pulse character will not look like you.
it helps me study a lot but i would love them to add post its, or a calendar where i could write deadlines, the game is really good bu the adittion of board would make it even better
good game that help with managing task while also reminding you when to take breaks

Incredible focus tool. I tried this alongside another popular option and found that I vastly prefer this one for pure concentration. The "game" elements here are light and serve to motivate rather than distract. Great WFH companion.
Really useful If you take the effort. Devs pls add wave sounds to the new summer scene!!! 11/10
Very nice, simple 'game' to help you focus and stimulate you to do your study/work. It helps me trough the hard study times - so thank you.

I‚Äôve tried this out for a couple of days, so here‚Äôs my take:

first of all, it‚Äôs very useful for the right people. If you have adhd traits and your brain doesn‚Äôt respond to ‚Äúshoulds‚Äù‚Äîinstead visual feedback, small wins, little rewards to look forward to, i really recommend it. personally, it helps me concentrate and find a sense of purpose in my tasks.

because it‚Äôs already good, I think the devs deserve to know what could make it even better:

- confirmation button when purchasing fish. because i‚Äôve bought them by accident more than once.
- there‚Äôs an optional break alarm, but i think there should also be an alarm (toggleable, of course) for when your break timer ends.
- someone else mentioned this, but: no sunny weather option?? wild.
- why can you only put an earring on one ear? please consider symmetry.

now onto less important, but still nice-to-have things:

- little bit of character customization like changing her hair color would be fun.
-more shirts. obviously. everyone wants more shirts. hawaii mode has quite a few, but this girl desperately needs more sweaters if you ask me.
- since people with adhd seem to benefit most from this game, maximizing customization and sensory comfort in that direction (making sure it doesn‚Äôt become overwhelming or distracting!) would probably bring even more sales. just a word of advice.

edit. also, if the post-its could be put directly onto the screen near the character, instead of having a section of their own? that‚Äôd be pretty dope.

It's adorable, simple and efficient! One of my two favorites of the genre, together with Mini Cozy Room!
Absolute recommend <3

Love ChillPulse, I was having so much trouble concentrating on my studies and this has really helped! I've been able to focus better and I even smashed out an entire 1500 word thesis in one day. 

I would love if there was more character customisation at the base level so that you can choose hair & skin colour, etc. Also, it would be good to be able to choose what genre of lo-fi you want to listen to instead of having to skip through the song list. Can't wait to see more scenes! :)
I can only remember my studies not the game. Must've been really good.
I'm obligated to leave a positive review to counteract at least one other negative review, because I'm feeling silly right now.
Great for people with ADHD that need to focus on homework.
Very cozy. Good for lofi music enjoyers.
Yeah, it makes me study longer.

Relaxing game.
A really good app to gamify your daily task. I'll purchase this app again on my other account so I'll get more productive. Worth the price!
This is awesome

Leaving a bad review just because Chill Pulse is simpler than Spirit City: Lofi Sessions makes no sense to me. I'll always pick Chill Pulse; it's supposed to help you focus, not bombard you with stuff just to scratch the brain itch. 
I recently bought it and honestly it's been a huge help. I can focus better on my studies and it really calms down the ADHD monkey brain. The songs are great, some help me stay in the zone, others are perfect for breaks because they're a bit more catchy. You can also turn them off and leave just nature sounds in the background, which is really nice. I've also been making progress on my book since I started using it and that is truly shocking for me. It actually helps me form a routine and stay consistent and somehow it tricks my brain into this because I see it like a game that I like to play, so it's like a quest. I love the cozy graphics, the interface which is very easy to use and the Pomodoro timer with the alarm is super helpful, together with the calendar and to-do list. Oh and the letters! Sometimes I send one and the replies make me giggle, it's such a cute touch!
Thank you for creating this. ‚ô•

PROS
beautiful stylized graphic, better than the 3d stuff imo. simple and does not have an overwhelming amount of animation or *pings*. super calming to use and really does help with focusing. 

CONS
- I wish there was an option to turn off the +experience fire icon that shows up when you go into focus mode. i've gotten used to it now, but at the beginning I couldn't help looking at it, instead of working... 

- if you want to turn off certain songs/tracks, you have to click them one by one. it'll be cool if there was a select all option or a drag and select option.

- you can only decorate your character's clothes, accessories and change the pets. however you can't really add anything to the room itself, or the desk the character is working on, or change the overall appearance of the character.

BLUF: Cozy background and ambiance. Not a game. Great Lofi tunes, Pomodoro timer for ADHD focus. Fun little games to add to the atmosphere.

I use this as a DM while prepping for my D&D games. Helps me not lose track of time while doing research, diving deep into lore and world building. To-Do List and sticky notes are handy. Music selection is fabulous. Customizing my character and her surroundings is a great bonus and minor distraction break that's fun. Pets just sit on your desk and look cute. But the fish!!

Nice app to gamify your studies or routine. I liked the collections in game (pets, accessories, rooms). User Interface is easy to work with, but for me it's only 4/5. My problem was sound for timer -- too loud and disruptive. And I would love to see in game stats for all my playtime like the number of finished tasks, all focus hours and so on. Your Planner let you see only day by day stats.
It gets repetitive but I got my money's worth. I enjoyed the different atmospheres and customization options!

I've been using this game as background noise to studying, and it fills the role well! I like the pomodoro timer, and that I can customize the time. I was surprised that there are little story bits via the ingame phone "chats", and they are so sweet!

negative.review:
pros: pretty pixel art and fun drink making system, good app to run in the background
cons: lack of features or user-unfriendly features, and very battery inefficient

i think chillpulse can be a good app if you go into it with proper expectations. it is not a very feature heavy app and what you see is what you get - if you like the pixel aesthetic like i do, it's a great app to just have running in the back/on your second monitor when you're working! the drink making is fun and i appreciate all the work that went into the art for this game, including the myriad of different drinks that you can make!

however, there are several issues that i have with chillpulse - the timer is a bit buggy, so the tracked time is sometimes lower than the actual time that you have been running the timer for. i think this isn't great especially considering that it's a productivity app. for minor issues, the music selection interface is user unfriendly - no mass selecting and you have to manually edit it when changing scenes. there are also only very few white noise options (i think there are only 3). 

my biggest problem with this app is how much it drains my battery. while it wouldn't matter if i was using a pc, i use this on my laptop when working and it is always the most energy intensive app (even compared to my browser) despite the fact that there is not much actually happening on the game screen. it would be great if this was optimised. 

i have a mostly neutral feeling about this app but now that i have cleared the achievements i probably won't be using it again unless they release a new update c": it can be a good app, but it falls just a little short of what i'm looking for!
I bought it to manage my tasks, but the text is hard to read and difficult to input.

pros: pretty pixel art and fun drink making system, good app to run in the background
cons: lack of features or user-unfriendly features, and very battery inefficient

i think chillpulse can be a good app if you go into it with proper expectations. it is not a very feature heavy app and what you see is what you get - if you like the pixel aesthetic like i do, it's a great app to just have running in the back/on your second monitor when you're working! the drink making is fun and i appreciate all the work that went into the art for this game, including the myriad of different drinks that you can make!

however, there are several issues that i have with chillpulse - the timer is a bit buggy, so the tracked time is sometimes lower than the actual time that you have been running the timer for. i think this isn't great especially considering that it's a productivity app. for minor issues, the music selection interface is user unfriendly - no mass selecting and you have to manually edit it when changing scenes. there are also only very few white noise options (i think there are only 3). 

my biggest problem with this app is how much it drains my battery. while it wouldn't matter if i was using a pc, i use this on my laptop when working and it is always the most energy intensive app (even compared to my browser) despite the fact that there is not much actually happening on the game screen. it would be great if this was optimised. 

i have a mostly neutral feeling about this app but now that i have cleared the achievements i probably won't be using it again unless they release a new update c": it can be a good app, but it falls just a little short of what i'm looking for!

Honestly, it's not bad per se, but it's not worth it compared to "Spirit City: Lofi Sessions", which has much more content and customization options. Chill Pulse feels too simple, at least for my taste. You can't customize your character beyond outfits and accessories often look sloppy when applied (like inserting a PNG). All the scenarios follow the same dynamic and it becomes repetitive, the story associated with each stage is a good mechanic, but it also feels poorly implemented. The music and background sounds are VERY limited, which makes no sense. The only reason I would recommend this game over "Spirit City" or others is if you prefer the pixel art aesthetic (which is why I bought Chill Pulse over others, but ended up regretting it) and/or if you really hate 3D art. One thing I did like is the pet designs, very cute.
I bought it to manage my tasks, but the text is hard to read and difficult to input.
too simple. it's better to use youtube.
I am obliged to leave a negative review because the classic music selection was trash and I'm a piano snob

pros: pretty pixel art and fun drink making system, good app to run in the background
cons: lack of features or user-unfriendly features, and very battery inefficient

i think chillpulse can be a good app if you go into it with proper expectations. it is not a very feature heavy app and what you see is what you get - if you like the pixel aesthetic like i do, it's a great app to just have running in the back/on your second monitor when you're working! the drink making is fun and i appreciate all the work that went into the art for this game, including the myriad of different drinks that you can make!

however, there are several issues that i have with chillpulse - the timer is a bit buggy, so the tracked time is sometimes lower than the actual time that you have been running the timer for. i think this isn't great especially considering that it's a productivity app. for minor issues, the music selection interface is user unfriendly - no mass selecting and you have to manually edit it when changing scenes. there are also only very few white noise options (i think there are only 3). 

my biggest problem with this app is how much it drains my battery. while it wouldn't matter if i was using a pc, i use this on my laptop when working and it is always the most energy intensive app (even compared to my browser) despite the fact that there is not much actually happening on the game screen. it would be great if this was optimised. 

i have a mostly neutral feeling about this app but now that i have cleared the achievements i probably won't be using it again unless they release a new update c": it can be a good app, but it falls just a little short of what i'm looking for!

Honestly, it's not bad per se, but it's not worth it compared to "Spirit City: Lofi Sessions", which has much more content and customization options. Chill Pulse feels too simple, at least for my taste. You can't customize your character beyond outfits and accessories often look sloppy when applied (like inserting a PNG). All the scenarios follow the same dynamic and it becomes repetitive, the story associated with each stage is a good mechanic, but it also feels poorly implemented. The music and background sounds are VERY limited, which makes no sense. The only reason I would recommend this game over "Spirit City" or others is if you prefer the pixel art aesthetic (which is why I bought Chill Pulse over others, but ended up regretting it) and/or if you really hate 3D art. One thing I did like is the pet designs, very cute.
I bought it to manage my tasks, but the text is hard to read and difficult to input.
too simple. it's better to use youtube.
I am obliged to leave a negative review because the classic music selection was trash and I'm a piano snob

The only reason I would recommend this game over "Spirit City" or others is if you prefer the pixel art aesthetic (which is why I bought Chill Pulse over others, but ended up regretting it) and/or if you really hate 3D art. I bought it to manage my tasks, but the text is hard to read and difficult to input.
too simple. it's better to use youtube.
I am obliged to leave a negative review because the classic music selection was trash and I'm a piano snob

pros: pretty pixel art and fun drink making system, good app to run in the background
cons: lack of features or user-unfriendly features, and very battery inefficient

i think chillpulse can be a good app if you go into it with proper expectations. it is not a very feature heavy app and what you see is what you get - if you like the pixel aesthetic like i do, it's a great app to just have running in the back/on your second monitor when you're working! the drink making is fun and i appreciate all the work that went into the art for this game, including the myriad of different drinks that you can make!

however, there are several issues that i have with chillpulse - the timer is a bit buggy, so the tracked time is sometimes lower than the actual time that you have been running the timer for. i think this isn't great especially considering that it's a productivity app. for minor issues, the music selection interface is user unfriendly - no mass selecting and you have to manually edit it when changing scenes. there are also only very few white noise options (i think there are only 3). 

my biggest problem with this app is how much it drains my battery. while it wouldn't matter if i was using a pc, i use this on my laptop when working and it is always the most energy intensive app (even compared to my browser) despite the fact that there is not much actually happening on the game screen. it would be great if this was optimised. 

i have a mostly neutral feeling about this app but now that i have cleared the achievements i probably won't be using it again unless they release a new update c": it can be a good app, but it falls just a little short of what i'm looking for!

Honestly, it's not bad per se, but it's not worth it compared to "Spirit City: Lofi Sessions", which has much more content and customization options. Chill Pulse feels too simple, at least for my taste. You can't customize your character beyond outfits and accessories often look sloppy when applied (like inserting a PNG). All the scenarios follow the same dynamic and it becomes repetitive, the story associated with each stage is a good mechanic, but it also feels poorly implemented. The music and background sounds are VERY limited, which makes no sense. The only reason I would recommend this game over "Spirit City" or others is if you prefer the pixel art aesthetic (which is why I bought Chill Pulse over others, but ended up regretting it) and/or if you really hate 3D art. One thing I did like is the pet designs, very cute.
I bought it to manage my tasks, but the text is hard to read and difficult to input.
too simple. it's better to use youtube.
